page.title: 14Nomansland Common,Sandridge
page.content: Nomansland Common was formed originally by a very large glacier during the Ice Age.In Medieval times there were disputes between the Abbey of St.Albans and Westminster. They both said that the land was theirs and wanted to use it.If they could hang a body on a gibbet for 24 hours without anyone taking it down,they were entitled to claim the land.The trouble passed when they agreed to share it.Later the land was used for grazing which kept the trees and shrubs down.In the past it was the haunt of highwaymen.It was later used for various sports.At times it has been used for prizefighting,a racecourse and cricket.Cricket is still played there.At the weekend people come to fly kites and model planes.Part of the common has been cleared especially for this.
